events.title: Francis Drake begins circumnavigation of the globe
events.description: English sea captain Francis Drake sets sail from Plymouth, England, starting his voyage to circumnavigate the world.
events.significance: This expedition significantly impacted English maritime dominance and contributed to the expansion of British influence globally.

events.title: Nanjing Massacre begins
events.description: Japanese troops capture the Chinese city of Nanjing and begin a brutal massacre and widespread atrocities against civilians and prisoners of war.
events.significance: The Nanjing Massacre is one of the most notorious war crimes of the Second Sino-Japanese War, with lasting effects on Sino-Japanese relations.

events.title: California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger sworn in
events.description: Arnold Schwarzenegger is officially sworn in as the Governor of California following a recall election.
events.significance: His election marked a significant political event, as Schwarzenegger became a prominent figure blending celebrity status with governance.

events.title: Kristallnacht pogrom begins in Nazi Germany
events.description: A coordinated series of attacks against Jews throughout Nazi Germany, marked by the destruction of Jewish businesses, synagogues, and arrests of Jewish people.
events.significance: Kristallnacht was a major escalation in Nazi persecution of Jews, foreshadowing the Holocaust.
